resources.string: This is a mobile Android app such that a beginner can use to learn about the Android Development Framework.
Terminology Button will show Android Terminology Search!
Websites button will show page of some useful websites! :)

string-array.name: appdevtermdef
string-array.item: ADB: In lab 1 I used adb command communicate emulated virtual device of android machine, and run app development.
Emulator: In lab 1 I used emulator command to emulate virtual device of android machine and teat for out app.
Android: In lab 1 I used android command to control and manage avd, also I used android command to creat android porjects and update my android sdk
Screenshot2: In lab 1 I used screenshot2 command to take screenshot of current shell prompt. Without running any other program.
Gradle: In lab 1 I used gradle to build module for android developing. for example build.gradle is where I Set SDK version for android build and library to use.
Pm: In lab 1 I used pm command to use shell code in android device . In order to list packages in avd and uninstall my app
Lint : In lab 1 I used lint command to check my gradleproject has any html errors in lint.html
Project: In Android studio, project is where name refer current work, you working on it. For example in lab2 project will be MAP524_lab2
Panel: In Android studio, panel is where show all current information of virtual device at the moment. It displays current process your studio working on and may enter codes or action.
Toolbar: In Android studio, toolbar is where all buttons for androids features located. For example SDK manager buttons located in toolbar.
Statusbar: In Android Studio, status bar is where show live process (performance) of your device current time.
Preview: In Android Studio, preview pane is where show what will be halt when you run the code.
Pane: In Android studio, pane is where you adjust of your layout size when debugged code.
Project: In Android Studio, project explorer is located at left side of window, where user can explorer directories of project currently working on.
.idea: In android studio, .idea directory contains sets for .xml files and contains portion of configuration data of your app.
Intellisence: In android studio, intellisence is where android studio helps to complete the code automatically.
Module: In Android Studio, module is where version of virtual device will use when they halt or runs code.
Live layout: In Android Studio, live layout is where shows live performance of debugged code.
Init: â€‹In GIT, init is where git initializes a directory as a Git repository
Commit: In GIT, commit is where records a snapshot of the staging area
Push: In Git, push is where you moves your new branches and data to a remote repository
Add: In Git, add is where adds a file and data in to staging area
Pull: In Git, pull is where you fetch from a remote repository, and try to merge with current workstation branch
Branch: In Git, branch is where list ,create and manage of current workstations content
Clone: In Git, clone is a copy a git repository, so user can add on to it ex) clone()
